content: auntykarenknits hogsmeade hat to visit hogsmeade village one needs a signed permission because we all have stash form and of course a warm wooly hat this hat was designed to be a quick easy warm hat to knit for charities more options… such as wool-aid gauge is not critical it will fit someone hats are long enough to provide full ear coverage finished sizes will vary with gauge changes your yarn sizes 15¼ 17 ½ 19 ½ 22 requirements may vary materials use doubled aran weight yarn instead of super bulky 1 cake rowan big wool cascade lana grande or similar i used lamb s pride worsted 190 yds per 113 gms should be about 87 yds/100 gms yarn is knit at a much gauge approx 13 stitches/4 tighter gauge than called for on ball band 42 stitch hat = 68 gms 114 yards size 11 needles 16 circular and dpn s 48 stitch hat = 75 gms 126 yards tapestry needle stitch marker 52 stitch hat = 89 gms 150 yards gauge 11 stitches/4 inches 60 stitch hat = 96 gms 162 yards directions use tripled worsted yarn for example patons cast on 42 48 54 60 stitches place marker and join to classic 220 yards per 100 gms knit in the round gauge approx 12 stitches/4 r1 purl 42 stitch hat = 70 gms 154 yds r2 knit 48 stitch hat = 87 gms 194 yds r3 purl 52 stitch hat = 98 gms 219 yards r4 knit 60 stitch hat = 107 gms 239 yds r5 purl r6 11 *purl 2 knit 1 repeat * to end of round more options r12 16 repeat r1 through r5 r6 11 try knit every row until hat measures 6 6 6 1/2 6 ½ 1 x 1 rib seed stitch or moss stitch moss st works then start decreases on 48 or 60 st hat k2 p1 around instead of p2 k1 decreases r1 * knit 4 knit 2 decrease repeat * to end of round r2 knit please consider donating a hat to wool-aid or your favorite r3 * knit 3 knit 2 decrease repeat * to end of round charity wool-aid
